text: An eclectic group of freshman English students sit around large conference table, chatting. LAUREN POWELL, 18, prim proper, and wide-eyed notices KATIE STEELE 18, wearing a through top with a black bra. Lauren leans over.
(whispering) I can see your bra through your shirt. (off Katie’s nod) It's just that you don’t want people to think you’re a slut on the first day of school.
Oh. Hey, do you mind if people think you’re a frosty bitch? PROFESSOR RAINEY, attractive and 35, walks to the head of table wearing a smart sweater vest.

This is freshman English. We write, we read, we talk. We should get to know each other. Lauren starts taking notes. JESSE LAWSON, 18, a gay bear type, hurries inside and sits between Katie and Lauren.
(whispers as she writes) Know each other...

I'm Tate Rainey and I’m from Jacksonville, Florida. One of the hardest things I’ve overcome is that although my penis is straight, my ass is gay. The class shoots to attention. A few laughs trickle out.
(quietly to Katie) Score! (notices Lauren's horrified look) Kidding. I like your headband.  They smile at each other. Professor Rainey continues.

See? The ice is broken. And I’m kidding. I’m not gay at all. But in college we can say whatever we want! Now, something I really did overcome is writer's block after my divorce. Not exciting, kinda sad, but true. Who’s next? Lauren shoots her hand into the air and stands up.

I‘1l go! My name is Lauren Powell and I’m from Stamford, Connecticut. And it was so hard for me to overcome my craving for ice cream sundaes. My dad made me one every night until high school when I had to stop cause I watched my weight. There are mostly eye-rolls, but it’s so sweet a few peopl smile. The biggest eye roll comes from Katie who pipes up
I’1l go next! Lauren awkwardly sits. Katie remains seated.
My name is Katie Steele and I’m from Baltimore, Maryland. Something I had to overcome, is a misdemeanor I got for flashing at a high school football game.
You can get arrested for flashing?

You do when it’s your vag! And I’m 18 now, so it’s not on my record anymore. I’ve overcome! The class explodes with laughter. Over Jesse, the two gir stare each other down as another student starts talking.
Lauren, wearing an Amherst shirt, wanders through the crowded, smokey room carrying an empty diet Coke can. She taps a DUDE on his shoulder.

Excuse me, do you know where the recycling is? The DUDE ignores Lauren. She taps another person on the shoulder. When she turns around, it’s Katie, who double f beers, and wears an outrageous and very revealing outfit. LAUREN (CONT’D) (earnestly) Oh, hi! Hey, I hope you’re keeping your skirt on at this party!
I’m just hoping they’1l have ice cream later!
(ignoring the insult) Do you know if there’s any recycling around?
Recycling!? This is a party, earth girl! She grabs Lauren’s can and throws it on the floor.

(tousles Lauren’s hair) Now you go have the time of your life! Lauren gives Katie a judging look while Katie hurls herse onto the keg to do a kegstand. INT./EXT. LAUREN’S CAR - A LITTLE LATER THAT NIGHT Lauren drives away from the now broken-up party. She sees Katie doing the electric slide on the sidewalk, stumbling her giant wedges - her revealing outfit almost revealing much. She’s wasted and has a party of her own. Lauren wat Katie and debates picking her up. The good person in her and she rolls down her window.
Hey!
Lauren Powell! Fan of the ice cream sundae!
Yes, that’s me. Do you maybe need a ride? Katie shrugs and then hurls herself into Lauren’s car and immediately starts playing with the radio.
Ugh, I hate Dave Matthews! What station is this?
It's acd actually. But this is a live cd. Have you ever seen Dave live? Or were you busy showing off your girl parts? Katie is almost impressed by the insult.
Oh man, I just realized I haven’t peed in like, four beers. (sees a big gulp cup) Is this yours?
Sorry, I think it’s empty.
Perfect. Katie jiggles off her underwear and tosses them on the da She starts to maneuver herself over the cup.
What are you doing?!
I told you I had to pee.
Stop! You can’t do that! This is my new car!
Oh come on, I do this all the time. It‘’ll be fine!
No! Don-- The sounds of Katie’s pee can be heard hitting the cup.  LAUREN (CONT’D) Ohmygod, ohmygod. I can’t believe you're doing this. Katie finishes up and holds the cup up triumphantly.
Finished! See, no spills at all. Lauren sighs.
Fine. Okay. Katie starts to put the lid back on the cup.

I told you, I do this all the-- SPLASH! Lauren hits a bump and pee goes everywhere! SILEN Lauren pulls the car over to the side of the road. The ar couldn't be scarier and is populated by SHADY LOOKING DUD SMALL CHILDREN selling drugs, and a PROSTITUTE getting spanked right there on the sidewalk.
Get out.
Here!?
(firmer) Get out.
But these people will kill me!

(re: the spanked prostitute) Oh I think you’1l fit right in with those two! GET OUT OF MY CAR! Katie collects her shoes and what’s left of the pee-fille and teeters out of the car. Lauren speeds off and then ve back in reverse. She tosses Katie’s panties at her head.
Fine! I HATE you too! And you should just chill out! Urine is sterile! Lauren speeds off leaving Katie in Scarytown. Unfortunate for her, Katie’s revealing outfit makes her fit right in.
(to Katie) Twenty-five to join us. And you can give or receive. Katie wimpers and walks off.

INT. MORTY BRONSTEIN’S OFFICE - LOBBY - DAY The phone rings in the most organized office reception ar ever. Out the window is a great view of New York City and the walls are framed book covers and literary awards. Lau reading a manuscript, answers it.
Morty Bronstein’s office?
(yelling from other room) Lauren!
I’m sorry, he’s unavailable at the mom--, yes, he’s reading it now. She looks down at the manuscript that she’s reading.
(yelling from other room) Have you seen my insulin injection?

Yes, I know he’s had it for six mon-- Well, I can tell you that it’s just great and has tons of promise... I’m practically an agent... We’ll return. Lauren hangs up the phone with a sigh. She opens her desk drawer and pulls out a box of syringes. She brings it int  INT. MORTY’S OFFICE - CONTINUOUS MORTY, 85, adorable, wrinkled, and knocking at death’s do sits in his chair - which is huge compared to his little man body. His office is a disaster area with piles of manuscripts floor to ceiling and papers everywhere.

There she is! Dear, would you mind doing the injection for me today? The arthritis in my right and left hands is acting up and I don’t think I can reach around. He maneuvers his body out of his chair and lowers his pan exposing his upper right butt cheek. Lauren grimaces and steps toward Morty with the syringe.
Fine, but can we talk about the Joe Kreitman manuscript after?
Of course, dear. You’re so on top of things. Oh, I saw that thing on the machine you made. Impressive!
The website? On the computer?
Sure, dear. Very lovely. Injection, please. Lauren forces a smile and braces to inject Morty’s butt.
Okay, on three. One, two, three. She pokes him with the syringe and he screams like a baby
Crowds of TOURISTS brush past Katie, also now 28, as she hands out comedy fliers.
You like comedy? An UNAMUSED WOMAN pushes the flier back at Katie.
I don’t do comedy. Katie shrugs. She takes off her jacket and ties it aroun waist, revealing a cleavage-baring top. She wipes sweat f her brow before she spies a HOT TOURIST in a Stetson hat.
Hey there, cowboy. Would you like to get into some comedy tonight?
I reckon I might! Will you be there?

I can be wherever you want me to be. Just take a flier you sexy stetson. The Hot Tourist takes the flier as he passes. Katie rolls eyes and sighs. Then, she pushes her boobs together with arms and tries again with ASIAN TOURIST MAN.

You like comedy? INT. KATIE’S APARTMENT - EVENING A pole dancing workout plays on the television, as Katie talks on the phone while swinging on a stripper pole. Kat pants and sweats, but continues to juggle the phone/worko STRIPPER WORKOUT LADY bounces around on the screen.
Now roll those hips, you sex kittens! Let your breasts jiggle and focus on your core! Katie rolls her hips very sexually.
(panting) Jesse! You’re smart and you deserve to do what makes your heart sing. We go over this all the time! Do not settle! I won’t allow it. You’re too talented.
Wrap an arm around that pole and glide and grind. You’re a cat in heat! Katie tries gliding and grinding with the phone, but can’ it. She slips off the pole and lands on her butt.

Shit. (into phone) Do not sign that shitty contract. Your book is better than that. I’11l call you back. Keys jangle from Katie’s front door, as she starts to pic herself up. It opens to reveal her landlord HENRY, 55, an young perfect looking couple, JAMES and CARRIE.
Like I said, this unit is full of windows, gets lots of light.
Hullo? Excuse me?
Feel the pole between your thighs! Henry and James raise an eyebrow and peek toward the TV.
Take a look at the bedroom-- it has a walk-in closet. (to Katie) I told you I’d be coming by. How's the packing going? James and Carrie smile awkwardly and go to the bedroom.
Packing? What the hell. You can’t just drop in on me, Henry. I live here!
Katie, I told you 60 days ago that the building is no longer rent- controlled come June lst. You don’t qualify for the new rate with your income.
And I told you that this was my grandmother’s apartment. And I’ve been here for 5 years! I’m not going anywhere!
Are those the certified letters I sent you?  10. Three PINK ENVELOPES on the table are peeking out from underneath a pile of catalogs.
Use the big pole to guide your muscles.
You've got four days, Katie. I’m sorry. James and Carrie emerge from the bedroom, beaming and nod with interest.

Oh stop nodding you cake toppers! One day, the drain in the sink is going to clog, and you’re not going to know why. But I’1l know. Henry ushers Carrie and James out the door. Katie walks t the doorway.

That’s fine! I deserve better than this craphole apartment anyway! Have fun with my grandmother’s ghost! She’s a night-walker! Katie slams the door with frustration. INT. CHARLIE SHEER’S APARTMENT BEDROOM - THAT SAME NIGHT Candlelight and the Boyz 2 Men song, I'll Make Love To Yo fill the boyishly boring apartment. Slightly tangled in t sheets, Lauren and her boyfriend, CHARLIE SHEER, 30 and l like Mr. Right, make really boring love. INT. CHARLIE SHEER’S APARTMENT BATHROOM - MOMENTS LATER Lauren and Charlie brush their teeth while wearing matchi pajamas. Him with just the pants, her wearing his top. Th have a whole routine with her moving her head up when his down and vice versa. When they are done, the routine continues with a towel exchange. Finally--

Office? Lauren nods enthusiastically.  11. INT. CHARLIE SHEER’S APARTMENT BEDROOM - MOMENTS LATER Lauren and Charlie laugh together in bed watching The Off They aren’t touching. It goes to commercial.
Well, I have some news. Weiner can’t do the Rome office stint, so I get to go to Italy for the summer.
What?! That’s amazing! I’ve never been to Italy before. All cobble-y streets and statues, old churches and yummy food! Charlie takes a beat.
I think...I think this is a good time for us to evaluate where we’re at.
(hopeful) Really?! Ohmygosh. Okay, wait. Lauren runs out of the room and returns again a moment la with a camera. Charlie's
What’s that?
I want to document this. If I don’t my sister will KILL me! face falls.
Honey, I’m not proposing.
Oh. Then what are you doing?
Here's the thing. I think we’re both ignoring something really obvious here and have been for a while now.
Ignoring what?  12.
We both jog an 8 and a half minute mile. We always go to Sarabeth’s for brunch on Sunday. We switched from sour cream to greek yogurt together. We dress alike. Charlie nods at Lauren’s pajama top.
I’m not following.
Lauren. Snap out of it. Last winter we built little ships together inside glass bottles. We always win at Taboo! And charades!... Our relationship is boring. Lauren looks punched in the stomach.
But we just had great sex with each other!
That was great? Look, every moment we spend together is fun, it’s nice, but nice is not a way to live! We have no excitement. No passion. We have...Scrabble night.

You love Scrabble! And I have passion! I can loosen up! Look! Lauren jumps up and attempts to dance sexily, unbuttoning several of the buttons on her pajama top. It’s all wrong. Charlie grabs her and makes her sit down.
Lauren. Stop. We’re just friends, okay? Lauren starts to cry.
Please don’t do that. I know you’1ll see what I’m talking about soon. Once we have some distance, and you have your own place and--  13.
My own place?! I can’t afford my own place! Couldn’t I just stay here?
The thing is, I’m gonna give up this place when I leave for Italy. In four days.
How could you do this!? We’ve been together for three years! So what if we’re friends! You’re my best friend!
Laur--

No! You are the worst person ever! Lauren jumps up and starts grabbing her things from the r LAUREN (CONT’D) You think I’m boring!? What about you, Mr. I only wear khaki pants and eat only plain chicken!? You're the one that loves the missionary position! I look good on top. My breasts look amazing. You don’t deserve my breasts! Lauren now starts throwing the things she’s grabbed at Charlie: a shirt, a shoe, a book, her purse, etc. He’s ducking and running around the room and saying ‘I’m sorry with every object hurled at his head. LAUREN (CONT’D) Fine! I'll find a new apartment! A great apartment! And I’m gonna have crazy sex there! And be exciting! And you'll have missed it all! Lauren hurls a heavy book-end at Charlie's head. He ducks the door. The second he’s gone, she sobs.
Katie stands in the middle of an empty living room, with BUILDING MANAGER. She shrugs.  14.
It’s...not bad. I came in a taxi, today, but how far is the train?
10 blocks to the J-M-Z train. And then you just switch to the L train or the F train after 6 stops and it gets you right into the city.
Huh. How long does it take exactly?

An hour? But there’s lots of people that commute from here or take bikes to the train. Katie peers out the window as a DELINQUENT cuts off a bik lock and steals a bike, peddling away at the speed of lig

head_text.subj: INT. TINY, AMAZING NEW YORK STUDIO- DAY

text: Lauren perches on a window seat, gazing at Central Park. broker, EILEEN, a mid-40's, Jewish-mom type, smiles broad
It's everything you’re looking for! A real grown up apartment: Doorman, windows, full kitchen, and not more space than a young single lady needs.
Single. Great. How much is it again?
Well, with first month, last month, security deposit, and a broker’s fee...$8000 to get in the door. And then it’s just $2500 a month.
(sarcastic) Wow, what a steal.
A FAT LADY with way too much cleavage smiles broadly at Katie, as they walk around an over-the-garage apartment.
Do you have a car, I hope?  15. Katie shakes her head.
Well, in that case you just walk to the ferry and sail right to the city. Katie turns to see Fat Son leaning in the doorway, smokin cigarette. He looks very “Staten Island” douche-y.
Or I could drive you. I’m in and out of the city all the time. (pointing to the main house) And I just live right there.

head_text.subj: INT. TERRIBLE EAST VILLAGE STUDIO- DAY

text: Lauren and Eileen stand next to one another in what is sa NOT a broom closet, but an actual apartment. An arms reac away from the kitchen sink is a free-standing bathtub. A has been folded down from the wall.
You can afford it! A place all to yourself. Lots of privacy. Lauren eyes the single, tiny window in the apartment.
I can’t breathe. Eileen cheerfully wedges open the window, struggling. It springs open. Loud screams from the building next door er
Is this about the baby?! I HATE you!
(in Spanish) You enrage me, woman!
Speak English! You've been here 12 years!!!
I’m not sure this is right either.  16.
Jesse, the guy who sat between Lauren and Katie in freshm English, struts down the street with Lauren while eating Taste-d-Lite.
Lauren, I know you refuse to see it, but Charlie’s right. You’re so not crazy for each other. You are best friends. (re: the ice cream) Am I getting fat? Should I not be eating this?
It’s fat free. And I’m totally crazy for him!
Oh come on. We haven’t been lingerie shopping for that guy in forever. (grabs his stomach) But look at this. He sighs and eats another spoonful.

Brace yourself. I’m gonna lay it out there. Your relationship has run it’s course. He’s gonna go to Italy and meet some woman who can make pasta with her nipples, and you’re gonna stay here and take over Morty’s business and get your life on track.
Maybe it’1ll only be a break?
Up. Lauren knows he’s right.
So my boyfriend is breaking up with me, and kicking me out of my apartment. I can barely afford any place that doesn’t have rats or screaming immigrants. What am I going to do? (MORE )
I’m 2 days from moving back to Long Island to live with my parents! I’m 28. I can’t do that. Jesse spies an open house in a beautiful old building rig on Gramercy Park.
You can live here!
Please. I can’t afford a place around here. (looks at the sign) And it’s for a two bedroom. Are you moving in with me?
Uh, no. I live alone. But let’s just go look. For our dream lives. He grabs her arm and drags her inside.
Lauren and Jesse stand in the doorway with their mouths w open. The apartment is a NY dream: Large windows, beautif wood floors, an open kitchen, and molding to die for.
Tears of real estate happiness are welling up inside.
I would do anything for a place like this.
Sex for money?
Funny. I’m gonna go look around. Just then Jesse spies Katie on the other side of the apartment. He panics and pushes Lauren in the other direc
Uh, great! Go look! Over there! Jesse goes over to Katie.
Hey you!  18.
Hi! What are you doing here? You have a great place.
I just looovve apartments, so I had to take a look! Does your being here mean you finally came to terms with getting kicked out of your place?
Whatever. That place sucked anyway. I would give anything for this place. But I could barely afford half. I can’t live on Staten Island. What am I gonna do?
Sex for money? Katie looks as if she’s almost considering.
Uh, I'll be right back, okay?
Lauren looks dreamily at the large closet in the bedroom.
Could you afford half of the rent?

Hmm, maybe. It’d be a stretch. But I could do it with my raise I’m gonna get. I am 28 years old. I deserve this place right? I could make it a world with no Ikea. But, I don’t want to live with a stranger. Wait, are you thinking about it?!
No. Again. I live alone. But, uhm, I think I know someone that you could live with that would love this very grown up apartment.
Who is it?  19.

She is so much fun, and I know would be into living here and making it great and you probably don’t even remember her, but she was in our major at Amherst and she’s lives in NY and works in advertising. She’s tons of fun and--
She once peed in my car? Jesse smiles and puts out jazz hands. Lauren rolls her ey and walks out of the bedroom. LAUREN (CONT’D) No. No. Absolutely no. I HATE her.
Just as Lauren walks out of the bedroom she slams right i Katie.
Oh boy. The girls look at each other with hatred until Lauren remembers her manners.
Well hey, you! Nice to see you!
It’s good to be seen. Lauren forces an awkward hug that neither are happy about
So. What have you been doing lately?

(overselling) I work for Morty Bronstein. His clients have published over 75 literary masterpieces. I’m pretty much his right and left hand. He's retiring soon and I’m going to take over the business. You?  20.

(lying through her teeth) Well, I’m doing some ground- breaking stuff in advertising. I’ve single-handedly pushed forward a great campaign for a chain of comedy clubs here in Manhattan. Our ads are...all over Times Square. Jesse chokes back a laugh, then nods.
Sounds great. Congratulations.

Okay you two. This is a fantastic place and you’re both insane if you let it go. So, I want you both to close your eyes and imagine: (they reluctantly close them) A big beautiful couch in the corner. Cute frames with nothing inside hanging on the walls. Brunch at a small table by the large windows.
You just described Monica and Rachel’s apartment.
I love brunch.
Of course you do.

I’m not done. This is not an apartment for someone fresh out of college. This is for someone who's got their shit together. Someone who’s making their life happen! This place is for the two of you! Now on the count of three, I want you to both open your eyes and forgive each other for your silly pasts and get ready to step into the future of your incredible apartment. One... Two... Three. The girls open their eyes.
That was so nice, Jesse.  21.
Almost as nice as kicking someone out into a world full of murderers, rapists, and drug dealers.
When it’s hot outside, my parents say that the car still smells like pee.
I was almost arrested that night for being a prostitute.
You peed in my car.
This isn’t going to work.
No, clearly it’s not. They angrily part ways. As they head for the door, they overhear JACK, the real estate broker, talking to MARIA, another interested person.
It's really a lovely building. Quiet, friendly neighbors, and of course, that key to Gramercy Park. Both Katie and Lauren’s eyes grow wide. They rush over.
Key to Gramercy Park?
It's so pretty in there! Katie links her arm with Lauren’s.
We'll take it. Lauren looks at Katie’s linked arm and pulls her aside.
(whispering) What do you think you're doing? I don’t want to live with you!  22.
(whispering) I don’t want to live with you either! But come on, look at this place. And Gramercy Park?!
(takes a beat, then) Can you afford half of the rent?
I can make it work. We’ll take turns being in the living room. And you can have all the brunch you want. Lauren looks at Katie. She looks around the place.
(to herself) I should make bold choices. Bold choices. (to Katie) Ohhh man. Okay. Let’s do it. But no Ikea in the living room! They march back over to Jack.

Sorry lady, but get outta my Where do we sign? apartment! INT. KATIE AND LAUREN’S APARTMENT, KATIE’S BEDROOM- DAY Katie unpacks garbage bags. A pedicure chair sits in the middle of the room. Lauren wiggles a pillow into a shabby chic pillow sham as she leans into Katie’s doorway.
Is that a pedicure chair?
Yeah. Isn’t it funny?
Funny furniture? Hmm. Keep it in here, please.
Whatever. Nice pillow case. Pottery Barn?  23.
Pillow sham. Anthropologie.
Where yuppy hippies go to die. (beat) So, I was thinking we could divide up the bills. Like you pay them for the first three months, and then I’1ll pay them the next three.
Nice try. But I don’t think so. Who knows, in three months, you could run off and join the circus.
Good one. I was kidding. (beat) What time do you leave for work in the morning? So we can figure out the shower.
Me too. Shit. You can shower anytime before 7:30. Are you going to come into my room all the time?
I was trying to be nice.
Next time, send a fruit basket. Lauren shrugs and walks off.
Fine. And don’t forget to bring the least to that place on twenty third tomorrow! INT. MORTY BRONSTEIN’S OFFICE - MORNING Lauren sits in front of Morty in his office. A humidifier runs in the corner.
So what’s the occasion?  24.
You just called me in here.

Oh right. You’re so smart. That’s why I hired you. (off Lauren’s smile) And that’s why you’re gonna be great out there on your own. (Lauren's smile falls) I'm tired. I’m old. Let’s face it, I don’t do anything anymore. It’s time to close the old place down.
But what about your clients? I was thinking that I could--
I took it upon myself to make this easy for you and set them up with fancy young agents.
And what am I?
You? You’re a secretary.
But I’ve worked as your assistant for 5 years. I know your business inside and out. I’ve been doing it on my own for the past year at least!
But you’re a woman and women are secretaries, not agents.
What is this, 1954?
A great year... Look, you make a wonderful coffee, but you’re just lacking something to make you an agent.
What? What am I lacking?
A penis.  25. Lauren is crushed.
Katie steps up to the teenage RECEPTIONIST, who is textin her phone and laughing to herself.
I’m just dropping off the lease for apartment 12-F. In the Gramercy Park building?

Oh, yeah. So, I’m such an idiot. I sent over, like, the wrong lease. That one was for 14-F. She pulls out a lease from her drawer. RECEPTIONIST (CONT’D) Can you sign this one for me instead? My dad’s bugging out. Is your roommate here? Katie shakes her head. Clearly she’s alone. RECEPTIONIST (CONT’D) Shoot. (looks around) Um, that’s okay. It’ll be just be under your name then. I mean, it’1l technically be your place, but if that’s okay with you, it’s okay with me. Katie thinks about it for a moment. RECEPTIONIST (CONT’D) You can forge her name on it too, if you want. I don’t care. Katie smiles sweetly.
That's ok. We’re best friends. She won't mind if it’s just my name. Forgery is so wrong.

Great. Katie hands finishes signing the lease and hands it over. walks out triumphantly, giving the girl a pageant queen w  26. INT. KATIE’S APARTMENT KITCHEN - THE NEXT DAY Katie, over-dressed for work in a suit, eats a bowl of fr loops. Lauren emerges from her room, in her pajamas, with empty red wine bottle and puffy eyes.
Do we have recycling yet?
Again with this. Lauren looks less than amused.
There’s a box under the sink, Earth girl. (notices the pajamas) Casual Tuesday at work?
I’m going in an hour late today. Lauren mopes over and tosses the bottle. She looks toward living room and sees the pedicure chair and a stripper po LAUREN (CONT’D) Um. What’s happening in there?
I exercise on the pole. And the chair is for my back. I told you. Lauren collapses at the table.
Whatever. I don’t have the strength.
Your eyes are all puffy. Were you smoking weed this morning?
No. Gross. Lauren sits at the table. Silence. Then... LAUREN (CONT’D) Have you ever been in love?  27.
Ehh, I can’t be tied down. I don’t have time to waste on personal relationships. Women will stab you in the back, and men only wanna stab you wherever you'll let them - if you know what I mean.
Then I doubt you’d understand. I was with Charlie for 3 years! I thought he was my person! same plans, same dreams, same bed. And now he’s gone.
Your person? Gross. Jesse told me you might be in denial about your boring relationship.
Whatever. And what do you mean women will stab you in the back?
Women are bitches. Bye woman!
Where are you going?
To the bathroom. Jeez!

(under her breath) Why don’t you just pee in this candle-holder? Lauren slumps in her seat. A moment later, Katie emerges heads to the door. I’m going to work. See ya. Wouldn’t wanna be ya. And she’s out the door. Lauren sighs, takes off her blaze heads to the couch and turns on the TV. INT. KATIE AND LAUREN’S APARTMENT-— LAUREN’S ROOM - THAT

Days of our Lives plays on the TV while Lauren back in he PJ's, sits at her desk looking at her bank account online  28. ANGLE ON THE COMPUTER: Checking 2537: $2047.34. Lauren si and clicks another window to a completed Monster.com job application. She hits submit job and picks up her cell ph
Hey, it’s Charlie! Leave-- Lauren hangs up. She dials her phone on speaker.
INT. LAUREN’S PARENTS LONG ISLAND HOUSE - KITCHEN -
ADELE, 58, and adorable, chops vegetables while SCOTT, 60 with an lovable comb-over, paints a chess set.
Hello?
Hi, mom.
Oh hi, sweetie! Hold on, let me get dad. Adele brings another phone to Scott even though they’re i the same room.
Hi my sweetie. How’s the new apartment? And your roommate?
Apartment’s great. Roommate’s whatever. But, uhm...Morty’s finally retiring.
That’s my girl! And you're finally taking over! This is great! LAUREN (CONT’D) Uh, no. He’s just retiring. I’m not taking over. scott But what about our plan?  29.
Yeah, well, since I’m a girl, and Morty’s a sexist old-man, there is no more plan.
What?

Mom, I wasted 5 years of my life giving insulin shots to someone that thinks because I have a vagina, I’m incapable of doing more than looking pretty. It’s over and I don’t want to talk about it anymore. Silence. Adele stops chopping.
Honey, nice girls don’t say vagina. scott (chipper) Well, okay. This is no big deal. You're smart, you’re professional--

Thank god, because word must have gotten around about our 2-on-1’s and I’ve had to turn down so many. We should charge triple for those, don’t you think?  115.
Audrey, from the Amhearst luncheon sits in a leopard prin cubicle while on the phone. She reads from a Jane Austen novel.

‘It is a truth universally acknowledged, that a single man in possession of a good fortune, must be in want of a wife.’ Now spank that meat, and pull my corset tight! My bosom heaves for you! Next to her cubicle is a zebra print cubicle in which Jes sits.
Yeah, put it in my ass! He is beyond excited about this. Lauren and Katie walk past the cubicles. They give a thum up to Audrey and Jesse as they head to an office.
Who knew there was such a big market for those two? They enter the office and close the door. On the door is sign that says: “1-900-Mmm-Hmm.” FADE TO BLACK.
